headline.main: Writer, Rejected for a Retail Job, Is Embraced and Vilified on Facebook

docs.abstract: A story of a failed marriage and financial implosion provokes equal and opposite reactions on Facebook. Why?
docs.snippet: A story of a failed marriage and financial implosion provokes equal and opposite reactions on Facebook. Why?

headline.main: The Marijuana Industry Comes to New York and Everyone Wants In

docs.abstract: The medical marijuana industry is coming to New York. John Leland and Mosi Secret, reporters for Metro, wrote an article on Sunday about the people who are eager to get involved in what will become a multimillion-dollar business. Here, John describes the experience.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is defending its health care law in court, arguing that the text of the law and Congress' intent allow Americans to receive insurance subsidies regardless of whether they're enrolled through insurance markets run by the states or by the federal government.

headline.main: Government Argues for Fed Insurance Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Government Argues for Fed Insurance Exchanges

docs.lead_paragraph: This year's Senate races have featured astronomical spending, ceaseless attack ads and innumerable slaps at a president who's not on the ballot. Largely missing, however, are ideas on how best to govern the nation.

headline.main: Senate Races Hot on Accusations, Light on Ideas
headline.print_headline: Senate Races Hot on Accusations, Light on Ideas

docs.snippet: This year's Senate races have featured astronomical spending, ceaseless attack ads and innumerable slaps at a president who's not on the ballot. Largely missing, however, are ideas on how best to govern the nation.

headline.main: LabCorp's $6.1 Billion Deal Doesn't Pass the Test

docs.abstract: The strategic logic behind the acquisition of the clinical trial outsourcing company Covance is hazy, Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews writes.
docs.snippet: The strategic logic behind the acquisition of the clinical trial outsourcing company Covance is hazy, Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Adobe Chief Marketing Officer Melissa Dyrdahl hopes to bring a spa-like feel to the experience of breast cancer screenings.

headline.main: A Builder Swears He'll Stay at 49 Employees to Avoid the Mandate. Unless He Grows.

docs.abstract: The comment, an owner says, was an expression of his frustration with just how complex the Affordable Care Act is and how the resulting confusion has paralyzed his company.
docs.snippet: The comment, an owner says, was an expression of his frustration with just how complex the Affordable Care Act is and how the resulting confusion has paralyzed his company.

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna Inc said on Monday it would buy Bswift, a software and technology services company that administers public and private health insurance exchanges for consumers and employees, for $400 million.

headline.main: Aetna Buys Exchange Technology Company Bswift for $400 Million
headline.print_headline: Aetna Buys Exchange Technology Company Bswift for $400 Million

docs.snippet: Aetna Inc said on Monday it would buy Bswift, a software and technology services company that administers public and private health insurance exchanges for consumers and employees, for $400 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday took no action on a closely watched case that challenges a key part of the Obamacare healthcare law and could limit the availability of federal health insurance subsidies for millions of Americans.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court Does Not Act Yet on Obamacare Subsidies Challenge
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court Does Not Act Yet on Obamacare Subsidies Challenge

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday took no action on a closely watched case that challenges a key part of the Obamacare healthcare law and could limit the availability of federal health insurance subsidies for millions of Americans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rosa Elba Santana struggles to comprehend what went tragically wrong for her infant twins at the Robert Reid Cabral Children's Hospital, one of the few places for someone with a sick kid and not much money in the Dominican capital.

headline.main: Deaths of Babies at Dominican Hospital Raise Alarm
headline.print_headline: Deaths of Babies at Dominican Hospital Raise Alarm
